intro: Ligusticum diversifolium, commonly known as the New Zealand angelica, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed and can reach up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are used in traditional Māori medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
